intro: Phlegmariurus parksii, commonly known as the African haircap moss, is a species of moss belonging to the family Dicranaceae. It is characterized by its dense, cushion-like growth form and dark green to brownish-green foliage. The leaves are typically narrow and pointed, with a distinct midrib and a slightly curled margin. This moss thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found on rocky substrates or in forest floors. It plays an important role in soil stabilization and moisture retention in its native habitat.
